# About me
I am a grad student in Computer Science and Engineering at The University of Texas at Arlington
My under-graduate degree is also in Computer Science. I have a a good understanding of Object Oriented Design and Design Patterns. My primary skills are in Java, SQL, JavaScript, HTML5, JSP and C++.

## Experience
### Analogic Corporation - Software Engineering Intern         June 2014 - January 2015
* Responsible for refactoring the existing Service User Interface for the VCT1600 CT Scanner product at the presentation layer using Java Swings.
* Developed applications in Java to parse Medical Image files and to convert Medical Image files from DICOM format to Analogic proprietary image format.
* Performed validation testing on the Service User Interface as part of release activities.


### Infosys - Systems Engineer - Product Engineering Division         October 2011 - May 2013 
* Worked on test automation for MPEG-4 digital stream management system.
* Developed test scripts using the tcl/tk package and GUI automation using QF-Test.
* Contributed to the test framework library by automating XML request and response messages using the tDOM parser package.
* Responsible for the setup & maintenance of hardware (Motorola CAP-1000 CherryPicker Application Platform, Dektek Streamer/Analyzer) in the digital video lab.


## Education
### Masters in Computer Science - The University of Texas at Arlington
Aug 2013 - Present  
GPA: 4.0/4.0  
Coursework: Software design patterns, Software Engineering, Algorithms, Web data management & XML, Secure Programming, Computer Networks, Data Base Management Systems, Cloud computing, Wireless networks, Health Informatics.

###Bachelors of Engineering in Information Science and Engineering - Don Bosco Institute of Tech (Affiliated to Visvesvaraya Technological University, India)
September 2007 - June 2011  
GPA: 3.7/4.0

##Technical Skills

* Languages: Java, JavaScript, PHP, Python, HTML5, CSS, C++, TCL.
* Databases: MySQL, Oracle 9i, SQLite.
* Data transfer technologies: XML, JSON.
* Operating systems: Windows 2000/XP/7, Linux.
* Design Skills: Algorithm, Database, UML, Software Design Patterns in OO.
* Development Environment: Eclipse, Android Studio, Netbeans.
* Mobile development platforms: Android.
* Testing tools: QF-Test (GUI test automation tool).

##Projects

###Movie database Web Application
Implementation of a web application to search for movies and get information about their cast, their posters, genres etc. using TMDb(The Movie Database) web service. Developed using plain JavaScript and Ajax.
* [Demo](http://omega.uta.edu/~sxa1001/shreyasanand/movies/movies.html)
* [Code repo](https://github.com/shreyasanand/moviedatabase)

###Foodie Buddy (WebMashup Project) 
Implementation of a web application that combines two web services: Google Maps and the Yelp API, using JavaScript and AJAX. Searches for restaurants within the map area based on the search term and marks their location on the map, and displays some information about these restaurants on the web page.
* [Demo](http://omega.uta.edu/~sxa1001/shreyasanand/mashup/foodiebuddy.html)
* [Code repo](https://github.com/shreyasanand/foodiebuddy)

###Pong
Implementation of a simple computer game, reminiscent to the Pong arcade video game from the 70s using JavaScript.
* [Demo](http://omega.uta.edu/~sxa1001/shreyasanand/project1/pong.html)
* [Code repo](https://github.com/shreyasanand/pong)

###Dropbox updates notifier
Development of an application (with GUI) using python which connects to a users' dropbox account and provides a folder and alerts (in real-time) when files (.txt/.doc/.docx) are updated in that folder in the last hour.
* [Code repo](https://github.com/shreyasanand/dropbox-update-notifier)
